model.name: Minimum Distances
model.pypy_template: # Enter your code here. Read input from STDIN. Print output to STDOUT
model.pypy3_template: # Enter your code here. Read input from STDIN. Print output to STDOUT
model.python_template:
#!/bin/python

import sys


n = int(raw_input().strip())
A = map(int,raw_input().strip().split(' '))
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

n = gets.strip.to_i
a = gets.strip
a = a.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n = read n_temp :: Int
    a_temp <- getLine
    let a = map read $ words a_temp :: [Int]

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Find the minimum distance between two different indices containing the same integers.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          n_t (read-line) 
          n (Integer/parseInt n_t) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          A_temp (read-line) 
          A_t (split A_temp #"\s+") 
          A (map #(Integer/parseInt %) A_t) 
        ]
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    A = read_array(N,"~d"),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.pypy_template_head:
#!/bin/python

import sys


n = int(raw_input().strip())
A = map(int,raw_input().strip().split(' '))
model.lua_template:
n = io.read("*number", "*l")
A = {}
A_temp = io.read()
A_i = 1;
for token in string.gmatch(A_temp, "[^%s]+") do
	A[A_i] = token
	A_i = A_i + 1
end
